Distinct High Energy Cutoff Variation Patterns in Two Seyfert Galaxies
Jia-Lai Kang,1,2‚òÖ Jun-Xian Wang,1,2 ‚Ä† Wen-Yong Kang1,2
1 CAS   Key Laboratory for Research in Galaxies and Cosmology, Department of Astronomy, University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, Anhui 230026, China
2 School  of Astronomy and Space Science, University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei 230026, China
Accepted 2021 January 4. Received 2020 December 22; in original form 2020 September 29
arXiv:2101.01497v1 [astro-ph.HE] 5 Jan 2021
ABSTRACT
Investigating how the cutoff energy ùê∏ cut varies with X-ray flux and photon index Œì in individual AGNs opens a new window
to probe the yet unclear coronal physics. So far ùê∏ cut variations have only been detected in several AGNs but different patterns
have been reported. Here we report new detections of ùê∏ cut variations in two Seyfert galaxies with multiple NuSTAR exposures.
While in NGC 3227 ùê∏ cut monotonically increases with Œì, the ùê∏ cut ‚ÄìŒì relation exhibits a Œõ shape in SWIFT J2127.4+5654 (ùê∏ cut
increasing with Œì at Œì . 2.05, but reversely decreasing at Œì & 2.05), indicating more than a single underlying mechanism is
involved. Meanwhile both galaxies show softer spectra while they brighten in X-ray, a common phenomenon in Seyfert galaxies.
Plotting all 7 AGNs with ùê∏ cut variations ever reported with NuSTAR observations in the ùê∏ cut ‚ÄìŒì diagram, we find they could be
unified with the Œõ pattern. Although the sample is small and SWIFT J2127.4+5654 is the only source with Œì varying across the
break point thus the only one exhibiting the complete Œõ pattern in a single source, the discoveries shed new light on the coronal
physics in AGNs. Possible underlying physical mechanisms are discussed.
Key words: Galaxies: active ‚Äì Galaxies: nuclei ‚Äì X-rays: galaxies

J2127.4+5654 (the middle and right panels). Following Zhang et al. (2018), we adopt a single power law to fit each spectrum and derive the corresponding
unfolded spectra for the calculation of spectra ratio. As approved in Zhang et al. (2018), the spectra ratio plot is insensitive to the adopted spectral model, except
for in the spectral range of Fe Kùõº line (which is dropped from the plot). For NGC 3227 we plot the ratio of the two observations showing the most prominent
ùê∏cut variation. The upward curvature in the lower left panel (deviation from a straight line at high energies) demonstrates clear ‚Äúhotter-when-brighter‚Äù pattern in
NGC 3227. For SWIFT J2127.4+5654 we plot the ratios of two observation pairs, showing both ‚Äúcooler-when-brighter‚Äù (the downward high energy curvature
in the lower middle panel) and ‚Äúhotter-when-brighter‚Äù (the lower right panel) patterns. In the lower panels , the ratios of best-fit models presented in this work
are over-plotted, illustrating the ùê∏cut variations have been properly accounted in the spectral models.
